conditions.name: Safety Review for Dose Titration
conditions.description: Safety data must be reviewed by the Safety Review Committee (SRC) before dose titration.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation (Severe)
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification due to severe ALT elevation.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation (Moderate)
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification due to moderate ALT elevation.

conditions.name: Low Platelet Count
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification due to low platelet count.

conditions.name: Low Hemoglobin
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification due to low hemoglobin.

conditions.name: Low Neutrophil Count
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification due to low neutrophil count.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% ↓ from baseline and below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury (Hy's Law)
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification due to concurrent bilirubin and ALT elevation.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, indicative of liver injury

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification review due to neurologic worsening.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for dose modification review due to psychiatric worsening.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Mandatory Discontinuation Criteria
conditions.description: Specific events that require consideration for study intervention discontinuation.
conditions.text: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30 mg/day
transitionRules.text: Participants will be initiated on ALXN1840 at 15 mg once daily and increased to 30 mg once daily on Day 29, following a safety review.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT is > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Discontinuation for Severe ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT is > 5 × ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematologic Toxicity
transitionRules.text: If Platelets < 100,000/mm3 or Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL, reduce dose to previous dose level.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Low Neutrophils
transitionRules.text: If Neutrophils > 30% ↓ from baseline, reduce dose to previous dose level if up-titration has occurred or reduce dose to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic/Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on neurologic or psychiatric worsening.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Specific Safety Events
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for: Serious hypersensitivity reaction; Severe uncontrolled infection; Use of disallowed medication; Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point on Day 29 to titrate dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day, contingent on a favorable safety review of data collected through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Safety-Based Dose Modification
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing assessment of safety laboratory parameters and clinical status at scheduled and unscheduled visits, which may trigger dose modifications (interruption, reduction) or discontinuation.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Discontinuation Review
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing monitoring for specific events (e.g., hypersensitivity, pregnancy) that require consideration for permanent discontinuation of the study intervention.
